title: Advanced Vocabulary and Grammar Quiz (Part 4)
description: Test your advanced vocabulary and grammar skills with this challenging quiz. Identify the correct usage of words, sentence structures, and more to enhance your language proficiency.

items.question: Identify the correct usage of the word 'perfidious' in a sentence.
choices: His perfidious actions were praised by everyone.
The perfidious river flowed gently.
She faced a perfidious challenge in her career.
Perfidiously, he kept his promise.
items.answer: His perfidious actions were praised by everyone.

items.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of the word 'ubiquity':
choices: The ubiquity of the forest was breathtaking.
Ubiquity behavior is appreciated.
She ubiquitously solved the problem.
Ubiquity flowers bloomed in the garden.
items.answer: The ubiquity of the forest was breathtaking.

items.question: Identify the correct spelling of the word meaning 'marked by a lack of interest or enthusiasm.'
choices: Apathetic
Apathectic
Apathetik

items.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of the word 'quixotic':
choices: His quixotic actions were grounded in reality.
The quixotic knight faced practical challenges.
She approached the task in a quixotic manner.
Quixotically, he solved the problem.
items.answer: The quixotic knight faced practical challenges.

items.question: Identify the correct sentence with a proper use of the conjunction 'nor':
choices: She neither likes coffee or tea.
Neither he nor she likes spicy food.
He nor she can attend the meeting.
Neither the cat nor the dog was at home.
items.answer: Neither the cat nor the dog was at home.

items.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of the word 'effulgent':
choices: Her effulgent personality brightened the room.
The effulgent stars shone in the night sky.
He effulged the dark corner with light.
Effulgently, the flower bloomed.
items.answer: Her effulgent personality brightened the room.

items.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of the word 'truncate':
choices: She truncated the conversation with a smile.
The truncated tree stood tall.
Truncating the report made it longer.
He truncated the decision with care.
items.answer: She truncated the conversation with a smile.

items.question: What is the correct plural form of 'appendix'?
choices: Appendixes

items.question: Select the sentence with the correct use of the colon:
choices: She brought fruits such as apples, oranges and bananas.
The fruits she brought are apples, oranges, bananas.
Apples, oranges and bananas she brought: delicious.
She brought apples, oranges and bananas.
items.answer: She brought apples, oranges, and bananas.

items.question: Identify the correct use of the word 'inimical' in a sentence.
choices: The inimical weather made the day pleasant.
He showed an inimical interest in the project.
Inimically, she agreed to help.
Inimical forces worked against their success.
items.answer: Inimical forces worked against their success.
